title: pow sqrt abs Math methods - write code

content.description:
Consider the following statement, which is intended to assign the value of the expression <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator open paren x plus y close paren squared and denominator the absolute value of a minus b end absolute value end root" is-custom-alt="false" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msqrt><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mfenced close="|" open="|"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mfenced></mfrac></msqrt></math> to the variable  result.  Assume that the  double  variables  x,  y,  a,  and  b  have been properly declared and initialized.
 double result = /* missing code */ ;
content.question: Which of the following can replace  /* missing code */  so that the statement works as intended?

skill.text: 2.C: Write program code involving procedural abstractions.
